rows.description: A general armor maker, part blacksmith and part leatherworker.
A painter of portraits and may sell their own pieces.
Bread.... Mmmmmm bread.
Though they can make weapons and possibly armor but they normally do horseshoes, tools, even pots and pans.
Makes books. You can probably buy scribe supplies here, paper, ink, quills, etc.
Bows, arrows, strings, etc. Fletchers are more associated with arrows specifically but they normally overlap.
A maker of beer and ale. Normally sales wholesale.
Laborers skilled in the building of walls and ducts. Freemasons actually formed from a bricklayers guild.
Meat is Murder.... Delicious Murder.
For all of your candle/lantern needs.
An elite tradesman, skilled in math as well as woodworking
A maker and repairer of carts and wagons
A garment-maker/seamstress.
Makes and mends shoes/boots.
A barrel-maker
A maker of inks, paints, dyes, and stains. A much more important job in the middle ages than one might think.
Specialized profession that enchants your items or makes enchanted items for you.
Engraves items. Works with or can be with gold/silversmiths or jewelers.
Farms.... Also produces eggs.
Brings in the bounty of the sea.
Deals with fur garments. The making and repair of them.
Glass vases, glasses, etc.
Occasionally has their own shops or works with jewelers. Sell silverware, fills in filigree, repairs jewelry.
They make hats and are often mad because of the process to make them.
Watches over and breeds sheep, cattle, and horses for the market.
Brings wild game, furs, and herbs in for the market.
Gems Gems Gems. Often has a gold or silversmith on staff or works with one.
A maker of furniture... might need this so keeping it.
Belts, shoes, even armor. This guy could be popular.
Keys and locks. Seems simple but can also be where housebreaking supplies are sold on the side.
Brings wood in for the market.
Turns the farmers grains into flour.
For all of your clay pot, jug, cup, dish, etc needs.
A builder of ships. Need to buy something that floats? Head here
Normally a traveling craftsman who repairs tin pots and other small items, often also a peddler but they can be in a city.
Winemaker. Might not have had their own shop except in large cities.
A blacksmith type shop specializing in weapons.
Basic Cloth, normally not dyed.
